languageTools.program.agent

Class NameSpace

  • java.lang.Object
    • languageTools.program.agent.NameSpace

  • public class NameSpace
extends java.lang.Object
    A name space has two main purposes:
    • It is used as a container to store various program components, such as knowledge, beliefs, goals, action specifications, child modules, and macros. Modules are said to own these containers and as containers it should be possible to reconstruct the code structure of the module (up to semantic equivalence).
    • It is used to keep track of the scope of knowledge, action specifications, modules, and macros. The idea is that each program item 'lives' in a particular name space and can only refer to items in that name space. For example, a rule can only use actions or call modules that are part of the name space that it 'lives' in.

      • The intended use is as follows:

      • First, create a scope local to a particular module by adding the knowledge, action specifications, modules, and macros defined within the module's context.
      • Second, call the method inherit(NameSpace, boolean) to inherit items from a context (e.g. the global program or the parent module context). Two cases should be distinguished: (i) The global agent program scope which inherits definitions from the init module (in this case no 'overriding' takes place) and (ii) the scope of a module that inherits definitions from its parent module (in this case, however, local definitions 'override' more global definitions; i.e. local scope takes precedence over more global scope).
    Author:
    K.Hindriks

    • Constructor Detail

      • NameSpace

        public NameSpace()
        Creates an empty name space and sets its owner. This NameSpace defines the scope of its owner (a Module) and determines to which items its owner has access.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public NameSpace clone()
        Returns a clone of a name space. This clone only provides copied references to the same items in the name space, i.e. the items themselves should not be modified.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The cloned name space.

      • getKnowledge

        public java.util.List<DatabaseFormula> getKnowledge()
        Returns the knowledge, i.e. a list of DatabaseFormulas, present in this NameSpace.
        Returns:
        The knowledge present in this name space.

      • addKnowledge

        public void addKnowledge(java.util.List<DatabaseFormula> knowledge)
        Adds knowledge, i.e. a list of DatabaseFormulas, to the knowledge already present in this name space.
        Parameters:
        knowledge - The knowledge to be added.

      • getActionSpecifications

        public NameSpace.Store<ActionSpecification> getActionSpecifications()
        Returns the ActionSpecifications present in this NameSpace in the form of a LinkedHashMap. Keys are strings of the form "name/nr" where "name" is the name and "nr" is the number of parameters of the action.
        Returns:
        The action specifications present in this name space.

      • addActionSpecification

        public void addActionSpecification(ActionSpecification actionSpec)
        Adds an ActionSpecification to those present in this NameSpace.

        If the action specified is already present in the name space (identified by its name and number of parameters), the action specification is added to the list of action specifications associated with that action.

        Parameters:
        actionSpec - The action specification to be added.

      • getModules

        public NameSpace.Store<Module> getModules()
        Returns the Modules present in this NameSpace in the form of a LinkedHashMap. Keys are strings of the form "name/nr" where "name" is the name and "nr" is the number of parameters of the module.
        Returns:
        The modules present in this name space.

      • addModule

        public void addModule(Module module)
        Adds a Module to those present in this NameSpace.

        If the module is already present in the name space (identified by its name and number of parameters), the module is added to the list of modules associated with that module. Validators check for name clashes and report any issues.

        Parameters:
        module - The module to be added.

      • getMacros

        public NameSpace.Store<Macro> getMacros()
        Returns the Macros present in this NameSpace in the form of a LinkedHashMap. Keys are strings of the form "name/nr" where "name" is the name and "nr" is the number of parameters of the macro.
        Returns:
        The macros present in this name space.

      • addMacro

        public void addMacro(Macro macro)
        Adds a Macro to those present in this NameSpace.

        If the macro is already present in the name space (identified by its name and number of parameters), the macro is added to the list of macros associated with that macro. Validators check for name clashes and report any issues.

        Parameters:
        macro - The macro to be added.

      • inherit

        public void inherit(NameSpace nameSpace,
           boolean override)
        Inherits definitions from other NameSpace. Local definitions from this name space override definitions from given (parameter) name space if override parameter is set to true.
        Parameters:
        nameSpace - The name space from which definitions are inherited.
        override - If set to true, definitions from this name space take precedence and those from given (parameter) name space with signature already present are ignored; otherwise all definitions are combined.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
